intro: Psoralidium batesii, commonly known as the Bates' psoralidium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that split open to release its seeds, a feature typical of many members of its family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
